meanings.sent1: She fell and landed hard on her aitchbone.
meanings.sent2: The doctor pointed to the aitchbone on the X-ray.
meanings.sent3: Carrying all those books felt like balancing them on her aitchbone.
meanings.sent4: His aitchbone ached from sitting too long at the desk.
meanings.sent5: The dancer moved gracefully, emphasizing the movement of her aitchbone.

meanings.sent1: He felt a sharp pain in his aitchbone when he tried to stand up.
meanings.sent2: The aitchbone connects the spine to the legs.
meanings.sent3: The pirate's wooden leg creaked as he tapped it against his aitchbone.
meanings.sent4: The weightlifter's strength came from the power in his aitchbone.
meanings.sent5: The ancient fossil revealed the structure of the aitchbone in early humans.
